tax_brackets.source: Gemini Web Search, 2025-08-10, 'New Zealand income tax rates 1957'
tax_brackets.notes: The values here are an approximation of the 1957 tax system. The rates are the 1956 rates with a 25% rebate applied. This rebate was capped at £75, which is not modelled here. The top rate of 76.5% is from previous years and is assumed to be the maximum rate.

ietc.notes: The 25% tax rebate is modelled in the tax brackets. The £75 cap on the rebate is not modelled.

wff.notes: NEEDS RESEARCH. WFF did not exist. The rules for historical family assistance programs are unknown.

ppl.notes: NEEDS RESEARCH. Paid Parental Leave scheme of 1957 is unknown.

child_support.notes: NEEDS RESEARCH. Child support rules for 1957 is unknown.

acc_levy.source: Gemini Web Search, 2025-08-10, 'New Zealand income tax rates 1956'
acc_levy.notes: This represents the 'Social Security Income Tax' of 7.5%. The 1957 search did not mention a change. The name 'acc_levy' is used due to the current data structure. There was no income cap mentioned for this tax.
